title: Killed a build, now Spack thinks it is installed
body:
I just tried building a package, noticed something was wrong during configure, and killed it with <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>C</kbd>. When I ran `spack purge` and tried installing it again, I saw:
```
==> parallel-netcdf is already installed in /blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.10.0/opt/spack/linux-centos6-x86_64/intel-17.0.0/parallel-netcdf-1.6.1-fq2r43zk2wcbpl3hrc5h6sfz2dwajbk7
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/soft/spack-0.10.0/bin/spack", line 198, in <module>
    main()
  File "/soft/spack-0.10.0/bin/spack", line 175, in main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.10.0/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 346, in install
    package.do_install(**kwargs)
  File "/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.10.0/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1161, in do_install
    rec = spack.store.db.get_record(self.spec)
  File "/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.10.0/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 81, in converter
    return function(self, spec_like, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.10.0/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 554, in get_record
    key = self._get_matching_spec_key(spec, **kwargs)
  File "/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.10.0/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 549, in _get_matching_spec_key
    raise KeyError("No such spec in database! %s" % spec)
KeyError: 'No such spec in database! parallel-netcdf@1.6.1%intel@17.0.0 cflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" cxxflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" fflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX"+cxx+fortran+fpic arch=linux-centos6-x86_64^bison@3.0.4%intel@17.0.0 cflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" cxxflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" fflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" arch=linux-centos6-x86_64^libpciaccess@0.13.4%intel@17.0.0 cflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" cxxflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" fflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" arch=linux-centos6-x86_64^libsigsegv@2.10%gcc@6.1.0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@6.1.0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64^m4@1.4.17%gcc@6.1.0+sigsegv arch=linux-centos6-x86_64^mvapich2@2.2%intel@17.0.0 cflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" cxxflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX" fflags="-axCORE-AVX2,AVX"~debug~gforker+hydra+mrail~nemesis~nemesisib~nemesisibtcp~psm~remshell~slurm~sock arch=linux-centos6-x86_64^pkg-config@0.29.1%gcc@6.1.0+internal_glib arch=linux-centos6-x86_64^util-macros@1.19.0%gcc@6.1.0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64'
```
When I ran `spack reindex` and tried installing again, I saw:
```
==> parallel-netcdf is already installed in /blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.10.0/opt/spack/linux-centos6-x86_64/intel-17.0.0/parallel-netcdf-1.6.1-fq2r43zk2wcbpl3hrc5h6sfz2dwajbk7
```
Of course, that directory is empty except for `.spack/spec.yaml`.
